availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Samuel C. Woodson (Hopkins Co., KY, merchant)

body.p: Hopkins County, Kentucky, merchant. Kentucky native. Married to Rebecca Woodson. Father of Samuel Woodson, Jr., and Urey Woodson. Merchant in Hopkins County, Kentucky, in 1860. Owned six enslaved persons in Hopkins County in 1860. Household owned an additional sixteen enslaved persons in Hopkins County in 1860. Merchant in Madisonville, Kentucky, in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, Madisonville, p. 834.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, Madisonville, p. 221A.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Hopkins County, KY, September 1863, p. 47.
"Samuel Charles Woodson Sr. (1825-1907)," Find A Grave, Memorial #64096661, accessed October 16, 2020, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/64096661.
